outputs.output_descr:
Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a concept whereby companies integrate social and environmental concerns in their business operations and in their interactions with stakeholders on a voluntary basis. CSR is an important tool for private sector to actively contribute to the sustainable development, which is a long-term goal of the EU. The Project aims to enhance the transparency and credibility of CSR practices and lay a basis for country level CSR measurement and monitoring systems in selected EU member states: Bulgaria, Hungary, Lithuania, Poland and Slovak Republic. 
The main objective of the Project is to enable measuring and monitoring CSR performance and the level of excellence achieved in CSR practices at macro and micro levels in project countries through development of country level CSR performance indicators and CSR practice monitoring systems and brokering agreement on them, building capacities for such monitoring, as well as developing/testing self-assessment tools for companies and enhancing their capacities to apply performance indicators.
